title: Invisibility cloak might soon be reality
text:
Invisibility cloak might soon be reality Technology renders small 3-D object invisible POSTED: 03:02 PM CDT Sep 21, 2015 Tweet Scholastic image 
Harry Potter and friends used one to great effect, but is a real-life invisibility cloak possible in real life? New research says it could be. Related Content Apple pulls infected Chinese apps from iTunes App Store 
Scientists said last week that they've tested such a cloak, made up of microscopic rectangular gold blocks that would conform to an object and render it invisible with visible light, according to a Reuters report. 
The test was done on a miniscule 3-D object, but the scientists said they believe the technology could work for larger objects, including possible military applications, the Reuters report said. 
The technology might not be ready for practical use for another five to 10 years, the Reuters story said, citing University of California, Berkeley professor Xiang Zhang. Distributed by LAKANA.
